stx.test.Assert

type
class
This class contains only static members used to perform assertations inside a test method. It's use is straight forward: 
 public function testObvious() {
   Assert.equals(1, 0); // fails
   Assert.isFalse(1 == 1, "guess what?"); // fails and returns the passed message
   Assert.isTrue(true); // successfull
 }

Static Variables

results : List<Assertation>

A stack of results for the current testing workflow. It is used internally by other classes of the utest library.

Static Methods

canceled<T>(future : stx.Future<T>, assertions : Void -> Void, ?timeout : Int) : Void

Asserts the future is canceled within the specified time frame. All assertions should be contained within the passed in function.

contains<T>(values : Iterable<T>, match : T, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
match: The element that must be included in the tested array
values: The values to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Checks that the test array contains the match parameter.

dynamic createAsync(f : Void -> Void, ?timeout : Int) : Void -> Void

parameters
f: A function that contains other Assert tests
timeout: Optional timeout value in milliseconds.
Creates an asynchronous context for test execution. Assertions should be included in the passed function. 
   public function assertAsync() {
     var async = Assert.createAsync(function() Assert.isTrue(true));
     haxe.Timer.delay(async, 50);
   }

dynamic createEvent<EventArg>(f : EventArg -> Void, ?timeout : Int) : e : EventArg -> Void

parameters
f: A function that contains other Assert tests
timeout: Optional timeout value in milliseconds.
Creates an asynchronous context for test execution of an event like method. Assertions should be included in the passed function. It works the same way as Assert.assertAsync() but accepts a function with one argument (usually some event data) instead of a function with no arguments

delivered<T>(future : stx.Future<T>, assertions : T -> Void, ?timeout : Int) : Void

Asserts the future is delivered within the specified time frame. All assertions relating to the deliverable should be contained within the passed in function.

equals<T>(expected : T, value : T, ?equal : stx.EqualFunction<T>, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
expected: The expected value to check against
value: The value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the value parameter is equal to the expected one. 
   Assert.equals(10, age);

equalsOneOf<T>(value : T, possibilities : Array<T>, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
possibility: An array of mossible matches
value: The value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Checks that the test value matches at least one of the possibilities.

fail(?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Forces a failure.

floatEquals(expected : Float, value : Float, ?approx : Float, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
expected: The expected value to check against
value: The value to test
approx: The approximation tollerance. Default is 1e-5
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing. @:todo test the approximation argument
Same as Assert.equals but considering an approximation error. 
   Assert.floatEquals(Math.PI, value);

is(value : Dynamic, type : Dynamic, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
value: The value to test
type: The type to test against
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the 'value' parameter is of the of the passed type 'type'.

isFalse(value : Bool, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
cond: The condition to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the condition is false.

isNull(value : Dynamic, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
value: The value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the value is null.

isTrue(cond : Bool, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
cond: The condition to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the condition is true.

looksLike(expected : Dynamic, value : Dynamic, ?recursive : Bool, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
expected: The expected value to check against
value: The value to test
recursive: States whether or not the test will apply also to sub-objects. Defaults to true
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Check that value is an object with the same fields and values found in expected. The default behavior is to check nested objects in fields recursively. 
   Assert.same({ name : "utest"}, ob);

matches(pattern : EReg, value : Dynamic, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
pattern: The pattern to match against
value: The value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the value parameter does match against the passed EReg instance. 
   Assert.match(~/x/i, "haXe");

notContains<T>(values : Iterable<T>, match : T, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
match: The element that must NOT be included in the tested array
values: The values to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Checks that the test array does not contain the match parameter.

notDelivered<T>(future : stx.Future<T>, ?timeout : Int, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Void

Asserts the future is not delivered within the specified time frame.

notEquals(expected : Dynamic, value : Dynamic, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
expected: The expected value to check against
value: The value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the value parameter is not the same as the expected one. 
   Assert.notEquals(10, age);

notNull(value : Dynamic, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
value: The value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Asserts successfully when the value is not null.

stringContains(match : String, value : String, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
match: the string value that must be contained in value
value: the value to test
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it
Checks that the expected values is contained in value.

stringSequence(sequence : Array<String>, value : String, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

that<T>(obj : T, cond : MustMatcher<T>, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Void

Asserts that the specified condition holds. 
    Assert.that(2, Must.equal(1).or(Must.beNull())); // Fails with: 'Expected: ((x == 1) || (x == null)), Found: x == 2'

throwsException(method : Void -> Void, ?type : Class<Dynamic>, ?msg : String, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : Bool

parameters
method: A method that generates the exception.
type: The type of the expected error. Defaults to Dynamic (catch all).
msg: An optional error message. If not passed a default one will be used
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing. @:todo test the optional type parameter
It is used to test an application that under certain circumstances must react throwing an error. This assert guarantees that the error is of the correct type (or Dynamic if non is specified). 
   Assert.throwsException(function() { throw "Error!"; }, String);

warn(msg : String) : Void

parameters
msg: A mandatory message that justifies the warning.
pos: Code position where the Assert call has been executed. Don't fill it unless you know what you are doing.
Creates a warning message.
